title: Nate Diaz ‘out of UFC 244 fight with Jorge Masvidal due to elevated levels’
text:
Nate Diaz could be out of UFC 244 (Picture: Zuffa LLC/Zuffa LLC)

Nate Diaz has claimed that he will not be fighting in the main event of UFC 244 on 2 November after testing positive for ‘elevated levels’ of an unknown substance.

Diaz is due to fight Jorge Masvidal at Madison Square Garden, New York, but that bout is now in jeopardy with the California fighter blaming the test result on tainted supplements.

The UFC has not confirmed the failed test or that Diaz will not be fighting at MSG.

Diaz wrote on Twitter: ‘I’m not gonna make it out to NYC for fight week next week because they say I tested with elevated levels that they say might be from some tainted supplements.

‘I call false on that cause I only take Whole Food or natural food supplements. I don’t even eat meat!

Your all on steroids not me pic.twitter.com/ykrZmRIoPS — Nathan Diaz (@NateDiaz209) October 24, 2019

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘So unit UFC, USADA or whoever is FUCKING with me fixes it, I won’t be competing. I’m not gonna play their game and try and hit it or keep quiet, as they suggested. I’m not going to have my name tainted as a cheater like these other motherfuckers who keep quiet until after the fight so they can get paid. Fuck*n cheaters.

‘I don’t give a f*ck about some money over my dignity and my legacy. I’m not staying quiet and figuring it out after the fight. That’s cheating. So fight game, I’ll see you when I see you. The realest baddest mother f&cker in the game.’

Masvidal has weighed in on the situation, backing Diaz’s assertion that he is a clean fighter.

‘You not the baddest mofo in the game (i am) but you are one of the cleanest mofo’s @NateDiaz209 I’ll see you nov 2. I know your name is clean. I don’t need @usantidoping to tell me shit!’ Masvidal tweeted.

You not the baddest mofo in the game (i am) but you are one of the cleanest mofo’s @NateDiaz209 I’ll see you nov 2. I know your name is clean. I don’t need @usantidoping to tell me shit! — Jorge Masvidal UFC (@GamebredFighter) October 24, 2019

Advertisement

Advertisement

The Express and Star report that, if Diaz is indeed pulled from the fight, that he is very likely to be replaced by British star Leon Edwards, who has been paid to be in training camp, if one of the main event fighters dropped out.

description: Nate Diaz has claimed that he will not be fighting in the main event of UFC 244 on 2 November after testing positive for 'elevated levels' of an unknown substance....
